story.label: Our Story
story.title: Two Worlds, One Heart
story.intro: It began in New York, in the rush of a city where two worlds, Belgium and Mexico, unexpectedly found each other. That moment slowly became eight years of shared life, shaped by movement, change, and a growing love for each other’s cultures. Over time, we fell not only for one another, but for the life we were creating side by side.
story.paragraph1: It began in New York, in the rush of a city where two worlds, Belgium and Mexico, unexpectedly found each other. That moment slowly became eight years of shared life, shaped by movement, change, and a growing love for each other’s cultures. Over time, we fell not only for one another, but for the life we were creating side by side.
story.paragraph2: We chose France as the place to bring everyone together. A beautiful, neutral setting filled with charm, great food, and wine to celebrate our families and the start of our forever. We can’t wait to celebrate with you!

2017.caption: Where it all began
2017.text: A chance encounter in Brussels brought two worlds together. Neither of us knew that this moment would change everything.

2018.caption: First adventures together
2018.text: Our first year was filled with discovery—learning each other's languages, cultures, and the little things that make us who we are.

2019.caption: Growing closer
2019.text: Trips between continents, late-night calls, and the realization that distance only made our hearts grow fonder.

2020.caption: Weathering the storm
2020.text: A year that tested everyone. We found strength in each other, proving that our love could weather any storm.

2021.caption: Building our home
2021.text: We started building a life together, blending Belgian waffles with Mexican spice in our little corner of the world.

2022.caption: New horizons
2022.text: Adventures took us to new places, creating memories and dreaming about our future together.

2023.caption: The question
2023.text: A magical moment when one knee touched the ground and a question changed our lives forever. She said yes!

2024.caption: Planning our forever
2024.text: A year of excitement, planning, and anticipation as we prepared to celebrate our love with family and friends.

2025.caption: Ready for forever
2025.text: As we look toward our wedding day, we're grateful for every step of this journey that brought us here.

rsvp.label: RSVP
rsvp.title: RSVP
rsvp.description:
We would love nothing more than to celebrate with you in the south of France. Please use the form below to let us know whether you’ll be able to join us. We kindly ask for your response by February 1, 2026. We’ll be sending formal invitations shortly.

We know joining us for our wedding requires a long journey for many of you, and we completely understand if it isn’t possible for you to attend. If you already know you won’t be able to join us, we’d appreciate hearing from you now as it will help us plan thoughtfully. Please know that you’ll be very much in our hearts, wherever you are.

gallery.title: Two Worlds, One Heart
gallery.subtitle: A collection of memories from our journey together.
gallery.intro: From a chance meeting in 2017 to saying 'yes' in 2024, our journey has been filled with adventure, laughter, and endless love. Here's our story, year by year.
gallery.quote: And now, we can't wait to begin the next chapter with you by our side.

2017.caption: Where it all began
2017.text: We met for the first time and something just clicked. Little did we know this was the start of something beautiful.

2018.caption: Building our foundation
2018.text: A year of getting to know each other, sharing dreams, and realizing we wanted the same things in life.

2019.caption: Adventures together
2019.text: We started exploring the world together, creating memories that would last a lifetime.

2020.caption: Growing closer
2020.text: A challenging year that brought us even closer together, proving that our love could weather any storm.

2021.caption: New beginnings
2021.text: We took big steps forward, building our life together and making plans for the future.

2022.caption: Creating memories
2022.text: Another year of adventures, laughter, and falling more in love with each other every day.

2023.caption: The perfect moment
2023.text: We knew we had found our forever person. The question was just a matter of time.

2024.caption: She said yes!
2024.text: The most magical moment of our journey so far – we're engaged and couldn't be happier!

2025.caption: Forever begins
2025.text: This is the year we say 'I do' and begin our greatest adventure yet – married life!

travel.label: Travel & Stay
travel.title: Accommodation
travel.subtitle: Vallesvilles is a rural village in the Toulouse countryside with approximately 500 inhabitants. This charming village offers a peaceful and authentic setting, typical of the Lauragais region, with its hillsides, open fields, and pretty brick houses. The atmosphere is gentle and welcoming, ideal for hosting a wedding surrounded by nature, far from the hustle and bustle, yet easily accessible from Toulouse.
travel.transportNote: If you are not providing your own transportation to and from the venue, we strongly recommend staying in Toulouse, only a 35 minute drive away, so we can help organize transportation for you.
travel.onsiteDescription: We're delighted to offer limited on-site accommodation at the château for our guests. Priority will be given to immediate family members.
travel.onsiteDetails: If you're interested in staying at the venue, please indicate this in your RSVP or send an email to <emailLink>rsvp@carolinaandthomas.com</emailLink>. We'll follow up with availability and details.

faq.label: Questions & Answers
faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.description: Everything you need to know about our wedding celebration in France.
faq.contactNote: Still have questions? Feel free to reach out to us directly—we're happy to help!

welcomeDinner.title: Welcome Dinner
welcomeDinner.description: Think elegant but not overly formal. For women, a cocktail dress, jumpsuit, or dressy separates work beautifully. For men, a suit or blazer paired with dress pants. Feel free to add a pop of color!

wedding.title: The Wedding
wedding.description: This is our most elegant celebration. For women, floor-length gowns, formal midi dresses, or elegant cocktail dresses are perfect. For men, a dark suit or tuxedo. Think black-tie optional.

brunch.title: Farewell Brunch
brunch.description: Relaxed but polished. Sundresses, linen separates, chinos with a nice shirt, or a casual blazer all work well. Comfortable and chic!

dressCode.shoeTip: The ceremony and reception will be outdoors on grass and gravel paths, so we recommend comfortable shoes—block heels or wedges are great alternatives to stilettos.

items.question: When and where is the wedding?
items.answer: Our wedding ceremony will take place on August 26, 2026 at Vallesvilles, France. The ceremony will begin mid-afternoon (we’ll provide a specific time in our invites). There will also be a welcome dinner on August 25th and a pool brunch on August 27th. These wedding week events are optional but we would love for you to join if you can.

items.question: Can I bring a plus one?
items.answer: Yes, you are welcome to bring a plus one! Please indicate their name on your RSVP form. If you're unsure whether your invitation includes a plus one, please reach out to us.

items.question: Are children welcome?
items.answer: Yes, children aged 3 and under are welcome at our celebration! Please indicate any children attending on your RSVP form so we can make appropriate arrangements.

items.question: What are the transportation options?
items.answer: The nearest major airport is Toulouse-Blagnac (TLS), approximately 35 minutes from the venue. We recommend renting a car or arranging a taxi. We will provide more detailed transportation information closer to the wedding.

items.question: Will there be vegetarian or special dietary options?
items.answer: Yes! Please indicate any dietary requirements on your RSVP form, and we'll ensure there are delicious options for you.

items.question: What time should I arrive?
items.answer: We recommend arriving 15-30 minutes before each event begins to find your seat and settle in. A more detailed timeline for all three days will be shared closer to the wedding week.

items.question: Can I take photos during the ceremony?
items.answer: We kindly ask for an unplugged ceremony – please put your phones and cameras away during the ceremony so you can be fully present. Our photographer will capture all the special moments!

items.question: Is there parking at the venue?
items.answer: Yes, there is free parking available at the venue.

items.question: When do I need to RSVP by?
items.answer: Please respond by February 1, 2026, so we can finalize arrangements with our vendors.
